question: Which nation forms the geographical distribution of "Baiji", a species of freshwater dolphin?
explanation: Baiji is a species of freshwater dolphin in which its natural range forms the middle and lower reaches of the Yangtze River to the mouth of the river in Shanghai, also Poyang and Dongling lakes of China. It is widely considered as this species might have gone extinct because of China's industrialization and urbanisation. IUCN Red List of Threatened Species classified the conservation status of Baiji as "Critically Endangered".
